cons: Very demanding environment to work in

review_title: unprofessional staff, lack of training, toxic supervision & more
pros: there's bubble wrap in the resource center
cons: The upper management go around calling staff "dumbshit" as a friendly jest. There is no training when you start your role, and then you are tested on it in front of coworkers. 1:1 supervision takes place with coworkers and upper management within earshot. Events are planned and handled by one person, until the day-of when it becomes a panic for everyone sharing tasks. Management of physical space also a problem

job_title: Student Support Supervisor in Calgary, AB
pros: Fun work environment and great coworkers.
cons: Nothing really. It was a great place to work at.

pros:
- chill staff
- helping out students
- always a changing work environment
cons:

- not much room for change in processes

review_title: A friendly and close community, project time managements could be improved
pros: Everyone is friendly and energetic especially the audience is college students. Informal dress code and casual vibes. Get to use creativity to express what would catch student's attention. Work-life balance!
cons: Offices are not the best, spread throughout the campus. Sometimes projects are crammed together in a rush. Career advancement within the organization is limited.

review_title: Mostly Great, But Total Lack of Proactiveness

pros: Salary and vacation time (2 weeks paid + usual government day offs + paid Christmas break + many other times off).
cons: Communication with Student Experience department is terrible. As well, that is where the total lack of proactiveness comes from.
